title: pgxCollation
description: A Collation summarizes information of all biosamples matching a given term (e.g. PMID or NCIT code), as well as the connected items if the code is part of a hierarchy (paths leading to the code, child terms).

examples: Beleut M, Zimmermann P et al. (2012): Integrative genome-wide expression profiling identifies three...

collationType.description: Key for the type of filter definition used to map the corresponding collation items (e.g. biosamples, analyses...). These only sometimes correspond directly to prefixes, when unanimous (PMID ...).

datasetId.description: The dataset the collation was generated from.

reference.description: A url to the code, in a local or remote location.

scope.description: The scope (i.e. the data collection) the collation items are retrieved from.

dbKey.description: The key in the corresponding collection (scope), in dot annotation.

childTerms.description: All downstream terms, from all paths of this term in a hierarchical system including itself.

parentTerms.description: All upstream terms, from all paths, of this term in a hierarchical system including itself.

hierarchyPaths.description: All term paths leading to any instance of this code from the hierarchy root term.

count.description: The number of biosamples in the collection with this code or one of its child terms.

codeMatches.description: The number of biosamples in the collection with this code. This can be 0 if the entity is only represented through its child terms.

HierarchyPath.description: A path from the root of a hierarchy to - and including - a given term id.

depth.description: The number of codes on the path upstream of the term.

order.description: The position in a rooted hierarchy, where each branch ends on a separate line.

path.description: All ordered terms of this path, starting from the root term and ending with, and including, the current term.
